arm_group.description: Long-term follow up of patients who received UshStat in a previous study

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to examine the long-term safety of an experimental gene transfer
      agent UshStat, designed to treat retinitis pigmentosa associated with Ushers Syndrome Type
      1b.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Determine the Long-Term Safety, Tolerability and Biological Activity of UshStat® in Patients With Usher Syndrome Type 1B

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Must have been enrolled in Protocol US1/001/10

          -  Must have received a subretinal injection of UshStat®

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Did not receive UshStat® as part of the US1/001/10 protocol

intervention.description: Long-term follow up of patients who received UshStat in a previous study

clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Study to Determine the Long-Term Safety, Tolerability and Biological Activity of UshStat® in Patients With Usher Syndrome Type 1B

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: The number and percentage of patients with treatment emergent adverse events.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Biological Activity: To determine a delay in retinal degeneration following subretinal injection of UshStat®, through changes in function relative to the untreated contralateral eye utilising retinal analytical techniques

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label
